uk.blankaspect.common.json

Class JsonParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.blankaspect.common.json.JsonParser

  • public class JsonParser
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements a parser that transforms JSON text into a tree of values that are represented by nodes. The input text of the parser must conform to the JSON grammar as specified in the following documents:
    • IETF RFC7159
    • ECMA-404

    The parser is implemented in the parse(CharSequence) method as a finite-state machine (FSM) that terminates with an exception at the first error in the input text. The FSM combines the lexical analysis and parsing of the input text with the generation of the output (a tree of nodes that represent JSON values).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  JsonParser.ParseException
      This class implements an exception that is thrown if an error occurs when parsing JSON text.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JsonParser()
      Creates a new instance of a JSON parser.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      AbstractNode parse(java.lang.CharSequence text)
      Parses the specified text and, if it conforms to the JSON grammar, transforms it into a tree of nodes that represent JSON values and returns the root of the tree.
      void setStoreExcessiveIntegerAsFP(boolean storeExcessiveIntegerAsFP)
      Sets or clears the flag that determines whether a JSON number that is deemed to be an integer but is too large to be stored as a signed 64-bit integer (ie, a long) will be stored as a double-precision floating-point number (ie, a double).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public JsonParser()

    • Method Detail

      • setStoreExcessiveIntegerAsFP

        public void setStoreExcessiveIntegerAsFP(boolean storeExcessiveIntegerAsFP)
        Sets or clears the flag that determines whether a JSON number that is deemed to be an integer but is too large to be stored as a signed 64-bit integer (ie, a long) will be stored as a double-precision floating-point number (ie, a double).
        Parameters:
        storeExcessiveIntegerAsFP - if true a JSON number that is deemed to be an integer but is too large for a long will be stored as a double.

      • parse

        public AbstractNode parse(java.lang.CharSequence text)
                   throws JsonParser.ParseException
        Parses the specified text and, if it conforms to the JSON grammar, transforms it into a tree of nodes that represent JSON values and returns the root of the tree.
        Parameters:
        text - the text that will be parsed as JSON text.
        Returns:
        the tree of JSON values that was created from parsing text.
        Throws:
        JsonParser.ParseException - if an error occurred when parsing the input text.
